subject: p19565653
Impression: AP chest compared to through. Elevation of the right lung base and hemidiaphragm has been pronounced since at least, accounting for atelectasis at the lung base. The right upper lung and the entire left lung are clear and the left lung is hyperinflated suggesting airway obstruction or emphysema. Heart is normal size. There is no pneumonia or pulmonary edema. No pleural effusion or pneumothorax.
